Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different types of land and water habitats, like a playground, garden, forest, pond, or stream.
The student can illustrate various living things found in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams.
The student can compare and show the different types of plants and animals seen in different habitats.
The student can display patterns in plant and animal diversity across the different habitats they draw.
